trans-unit.source: Get Started with Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Event Hubs; sending events with Java and receiving them in an Apache Storm cluster.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Event Hubs; sending events with Java and receiving them in an Apache Storm cluster.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Event Hubs is a highly scalable ingestion system that can intake millions of events per second, enabling an application to process and analyze the massive amounts of data produced by your connected devices and applications.
trans-unit.target: Event Hubs is a highly scalable ingestion system that can intake millions of events per second, enabling an application to process and analyze the massive amounts of data produced by your connected devices and applications.

trans-unit.source: Once collected into Event Hubs, you can transform and store data using any real-time analytics provider or storage cluster.
trans-unit.target: Once collected into Event Hubs, you can transform and store data using any real-time analytics provider or storage cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information, please see [Event Hubs Overview].
trans-unit.target: For more information, please see [Event Hubs Overview].

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will learn how to collect messages into an Event Hub using a console application in Java, and to retrieve them in parallel using Apache Storm.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will learn how to collect messages into an Event Hub using a console application in Java, and to retrieve them in parallel using Apache Storm.

trans-unit.source: In order to complete this tutorial you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: In order to complete this tutorial you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: A Java development environment configured to run <link><linkText>Maven</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A Java development environment configured to run <link><linkText>Maven</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we will assume <link><linkText>Eclipse</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we will assume <link><linkText>Eclipse</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: <html></html>If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <html></html>Azure Free Trial<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: Create an Event Hub
trans-unit.target: Create an Event Hub

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure management portal], and click NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure management portal], and click NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click App Services, then Service Bus, then Event Hub, and then Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: Click App Services, then Service Bus, then Event Hub, and then Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your Even Hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a new Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your Even Hub, select your desired region, and then click Create a new Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace you just created (usually *event hub name*-ns).
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace you just created (usually *event hub name*-ns).

trans-unit.source: Click the Event Hubs tab at the top of the page, and then click the Event Hub you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the Event Hubs tab at the top of the page, and then click the Event Hub you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the Configure tab at the top of the page, add a rule called SendRule with Send rights, add another rule called ReceiveRule with Listen rights, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click the Configure tab at the top of the page, add a rule called SendRule with Send rights, add another rule called ReceiveRule with Listen rights, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the same page, take note of the generated keys for SendRule and ReceiveRule.
trans-unit.target: On the same page, take note of the generated keys for SendRule and ReceiveRule.

trans-unit.source: Your Event Hub is now created, and you have the connection strings you need to send and receive events.
trans-unit.target: Your Event Hub is now created, and you have the connection strings you need to send and receive events.

trans-unit.source: Run the applications
trans-unit.target: Run the applications

trans-unit.source: Now you are ready to run the applications.
trans-unit.target: Now you are ready to run the applications.

trans-unit.source: Run the LogTopology class from Eclipse, then wait for it to start the receivers for all the partitions.
trans-unit.target: Run the LogTopology class from Eclipse, then wait for it to start the receivers for all the partitions.

trans-unit.source: Run the Sender project, press Enter in the console window, and see the events appear in the receiver window.
trans-unit.target: Run the Sender project, press Enter in the console window, and see the events appear in the receiver window.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial only, use Storm in local mode for development purposes.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial only, use Storm in local mode for development purposes.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the [HDInsight Storm Overview] and the official [Apache Storm] documentation for more information of Storm deployments and patterns.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the [HDInsight Storm Overview] and the official [Apache Storm] documentation for more information of Storm deployments and patterns.

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: The following resources are available for developing applications integrating Event Hubs and Storm.
trans-unit.target: The following resources are available for developing applications integrating Event Hubs and Storm.

trans-unit.source: [Analyzing sensor data with Storm and HDInsight] is a full scenario tutorial using Event Hubs, Storm, and HBase to ingest sensor data in an Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: [Analyzing sensor data with Storm and HDInsight] is a full scenario tutorial using Event Hubs, Storm, and HBase to ingest sensor data in an Hadoop cluster.

trans-unit.source: [Develop streaming data processing applications with SCP.NET and C# on Storm and HDInsight] is a tutorial on how to write Storm pipelines using C#.
trans-unit.target: [Develop streaming data processing applications with SCP.NET and C# on Storm and HDInsight] is a tutorial on how to write Storm pipelines using C#.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
